title: Terrible experience
text: I‚Äôve used this app for several years, honestly it‚Äôs getting worse. Many glitches, bugs and crashes just become the norm. The dev cannot bother to add new features or simply add tree names to ui as many users suggested. The subscription is not worth it, just the same features repackaged so I can‚Äôt image how mad other paid users might feel when basic features got taken away for monetization. And guess what, even after I paid for the subscription, the app still ask me to watch ads when ads should‚Äôve been removed for subscribed users. It feels like a scam and I‚Äôm considering switching to other productivity app.

title: Been using this for 10 years
text: I started using forest back in 2016 while studying and have used it consistently since then. This app has been a game changer for me and has really been instrumental in keeping me focused and consistent

title: Getting ads after buying pro subscription
text: After a recent update (around 1-2 months back), the app started showing ad popups even though I bought a lifetime pro subscription last year. I don‚Äôt want to see Plus subscription ads or banner when I already paid for Pro. Don‚Äôt try to cheat your customers. I don‚Äôt wanna see Plus banners on the trees I already purchased. This is horrible practice and the developers are losing all their credibility and goodwill.

title: Used to work, doesn‚Äôt anymore.
text: Doesn‚Äôt block screen time, and even though I paid for the app it still asks for a subscription. Essentially a glorified timer app.

title: Helps with my productivity
text: I love forest and it has been the only productive app that i use and is helpful to me.

title: Beautiful new UI + Ridiculous Negative Reviews
text:
So I initially agreed with everyone complaining that we paid for the app so there should be no subscription model, but after using the app for a few days... 
1) Users are lying about being forced to subscribe. You can X out of it.
2) The trees aren't locked behind the subscription at all. As far as I can tell you can buy them all with coins or gems which you can get from planting trees and participating in the challenges. I don't like the implication that people are making that all trees should just 'be free'. I do think they're overpriced in game currency tbh. 3x what they should cost. I'm an elixer buyer which doubles my coins and I still feel like they should be half. I've logged hours upon hours and only have enough for one nice tree as most are priced around 2000 and it's way harder to collect the gems. Still, I love being incentivized to actually use the app. The coin + gem + tree rewards, being able to see your own forest, and being able to plant real trees is all SUPER rewarding. 

The new UI is stunning and I really like the new breathing buddy! I do think for people who paid for the app everything should either be purchasable by collecting game currency or free though. Specifically in the context of the other breathing scapes, I feel like they should be free or purchasable with game currency for paid users. I know in Canada they get the app for free so I understand it being different for them

title: Works great!
text: It‚Äôs is great for focusing, but I wish you could allow more apps without having to pay. And it would be helpful if there was a to do list attached. But overall it‚Äôs amazing.

title: Changes are awful
text: I‚Äôve been a faithful user of for 10 years prior to these changes. I understand that business models change and that apps need to make money- fine. Added new features that you want people to pay for? Fine too. But to take existing features (something as simple as creating custom tags) and lock it behind a subscription paywall, after those users ALREADY paid for Forest a decade ago is absolutely absurd.

title: Ruined
text: This app used to be great. The developers have ruined it by forcing this pro subscription on everyone - even people that BOUGHT THE APP. They use terrible AI art for any new trees. Shove the pro subscription down your throat. Useless app now - use something else!

title: Additional paywalls
text: I love this app, I‚Äôve used it for almost 4 years but I‚Äôm really disappointed that I have to now pay 6 dollars a month to unlock the vast majority of the game content now. New trees and plants were already very seldom released, and now following an addition of tons of new trees, I have to pay if I want to use them. I imagine any new content the game releases following this you will also have to pay additional money for or already have the monthly subscription. Very disappointed.

title: Was good until it became subscription based
text: This app was perfect when it was a 1 time $10 purchase and you got pretty much everything you needed. Now they‚Äôve added a subscription based model with no regard for people who already purchased the app. Sad to see it fall.

title: TERRIBLE

Make yourself free or every slewer side going forward will be on your company hands. Hope you‚Äôre proud of your 7 figure salaries. Hope you choke on caviar.

title: Great but Drains Battery!
text: I‚Äôve used it for over two years now, and it‚Äôs amazing. It works perfectly for how my ADHD mind processes time and task separation. But recently, it has begun to sap a LOT of battery, before it was unnoticeable, but now I know I‚Äôll have 10-20% less battery after a day of using it at work. The settings app on my phone shows that it is using a lot of battery life in the background, which is a little concerning but I‚Äôm hoping it‚Äôs a bug!

title: Forest is a Evil Money Snake
text:
This app used to be amazing back in the day. It had everything and more all for 10 bucks, one time payment, and you got to support a good cause.
Now, over this year especially, forest as being a greedy moneymaking company. I wanted to recommend this app to my friends only to find out you guys are now charging an outrageous amount of money PER MONTH, for the most basic features that we could get from using a damn excel sheet and some code. I‚Äôm disappointed in what this app has become. This whole ‚Äúeverything needs to be a subscription‚Äù thing is ruining the world. People cannot afford this. BRING BACK PRO!!!!!! BRING BACK ONE TIME PAYMENTS!!!!

title: 3+ years with this app, simple and beautiful interface, i love
text: i will never delete this app. it‚Äôs the perfect timer and has no unnecessary bells and whistles and i don‚Äôt feel like stuff is being sold to me all the time. it‚Äôs simple and does its job and has a great interface and i like that tags/labels you can put for the timer so you can see how you‚Äôre distributing your time with each subject

title: No longer: My favorite app since childhood
text:
I have used this app for roughly 10 years. Forest is part of my life now.

Update 2025:
This app used to be so simple and graphically pleasing. Work flow was straightforward: open app, plant, view your forest. 

But now, it expanded and developed AI assisted features, meditations, events, extra plant purchases.  I used it because it is pleasing and it limits distractions. 

There are SO MANY DISTRACTIONS that it feels a burden to use. 

The graphic design is also INCONSISTENT and even UGLY. We don‚Äôt need so many new trees updates if their qualities are low. The new plants seem to be made by AI. What has happened to the company?

I was a loyal user for so many years. I loved the app for its simplicity and beautiful design. But not anymore. I am writing this long review for the hope that things can be changed.

title: Full of glitches
text: It‚Äôs no longer awarding the double coins when you watch an ad and I haven‚Äôt been able to get past the starter challenge, which is required to join new challenges, because of an error in their system. This app is a mess.

title: You paid for nothing
text: I bought an app to pay more inside app. Very little "free" content inside

title: Switched to Subscription Stoled My Money
text: I paid for an account and they just reset it so I lost everything I paid for and earned over the years so they can move it to a subscription service. I was fine when I didn‚Äôt get all the new stuff. But now I don‚Äôt get what I already paid for.

title: Mis-taps & a Hassle to Exit + No Shortcut Support
text:
Originally, after planting a tree, the Rest button was the most prominent at the bottom, making it simple to end the session, and back to main screen. Now Forest has replaced this with its Rest & Breathing Timer, since that button is still the most prominent one on the screen, it‚Äôs way too easy to mis-tap by accident. To make it even more frustrating, you have to long-press just to exit the Rest & Breathing Timer once you‚Äôve mis-tapped it, which is such a counterintuitive, annoying design.

What‚Äôs more, I really dislike that Forest requires you to open the app directly for all actions. I much prefer launching focus timers via Shortcuts, as it lets me start a session without any distractions. If Forest won‚Äôt add support for Shortcuts for a seamless start, it should at the very least polish the basic in-app experience‚Äîbut this forced update only ruins it with poor design choices.

title: Version 5.0.2 Constant Bugs [EDITED 01/21/2026)
text:
[EDIT: 01/21/2026]

FIXED! Thank you Forest developers! The app runs as smoothly as it has in the past. Here‚Äôs to another year of mindfulness! 

Original Review: 

I love Forest and am willing to change my review once the V.5.0.2 bugs are fixed! Ever since this newest update my app crashes nonstop after completing a Focus session, leading to some of my planted trees not showing up in my forest and losing the coins gained for each focus session. Please fix these bugs so I can continue using Forest!

title: Switch-a-roo

title: Ads, and app purchases
text:
Dear Forest, 
Why are there ads in this damn app that I paid 3 bucks for? Also, there shouldn‚Äôt be that many in app purchases in my face all the time.
There‚Äôs no reason why the app should be actively asking for more of my money after I already paid for the app. 
Nonetheless, I have a great experience with the app even without the additional content that you‚Äôd have to pay for.
A suggestion here, since the suggestion Google form appears to be down, please make it so I can add friends by syncing my contacts.

Used to love this app and now I hate it.

title: Using Forest for 4 years. Never again.
text:
I've been a Forest user since 2022, ever since they had the limited BTS TinyTan trees. I loved this app, and happily paid for the triple coin elixir regularly. It was $2, and helped me buy cute trees easier. When the Plus subscriptions started, I was a few days into an elixir, and signed up for Plus with the early bird sale ($35), thinking that the triple-coin benefit would just continue.

Nope. I haven't been getting my triple coin in a week even after paying $35 for the yearly subscription. I can't even buy an elixir to make up for this, because the app is SAYING I have triple coin but I'm not GETTING triple coin.

No problem, I can just message tech support. They were absolutely no help. Gave me 600 coin, what I would make in 2 or less days (that's how often I use this app), and told me I'm SOL before closing the ticket as "resolved." 

I feel like I've been scammed. $35 for one of the most appealing features to be completely broken.

title: They changed it and I lost all progress.
text: I love this app and have been using it for a couple years. However they just updated it and now every feature expect the basic timer is only available by subscription. This is extremely frustrating as I had already had many different tags set up for all the different things I used to the focus for. The second the subscription change happened. All of my tags for the past year went away. Now I can‚Äôt see what I have focused on and how long I have spent on each thing. Unfortunately, for something like a timer a $35 subscription per year just is not worth it for me. I am extremely disappointed as this has been my favorite focus timer app. Unfortunately, I will not be using it anymore.

title: Features I PAID for were removed
text:
I‚Äôm really upset because about two months after I paid to download this app, multiple core features were removed and are now locked behind a monthly subscription.

I have no issue with the app introducing a subscription for additional features. The problem is that I specifically paid for this app with the understanding that these features were included. Removing functionality that paying users already purchased feels lazy and scummy, especially when the alternative would be to simply add new premium features instead.

Some features that were removed include:
	‚Ä¢	The ability to choose which apps are blocked during a focus period
	‚Ä¢	Viewing detailed focus stats (such as which days and times you focus most)
	‚Ä¢	Creating and editing custom tags to label and group study sessions

On top of this, ads were added, and the app constantly pushes the subscription.

I genuinely enjoyed this app and found it helpful, but it has now become a source of frustration. All I‚Äôm asking is that the features I paid for be returned, and that subscriptions enhance the experience for subscribers rather than restrict it for everyone else.

title: Reversed hours and Days and Months Display Issue
text:
Hello,

I would like to report an issue in the app related to the date and time sequence.

The order of days, hours, weeks, and months appears to be reversed.
For example:
	‚Ä¢	Sunday is displayed as Saturday
	‚Ä¢	Monday is displayed as Friday
	‚Ä¢	Similarly, the months are reversed:
	‚Ä¢	Month 1 is shown as 12
	‚Ä¢	Month 2 is shown as 11, and so on.

It seems that the calendar/time indexing is inverted, which causes incorrect labeling of days and months.

I would appreciate it if you could look into this issue and fix the reversed sequence.

title: Great app for focus
text: Forest is a really great app for focusing it has this great idea of planting trees in your forest to make you focus, I am so glad that I purchased it.

it has always been a 5 star app for me, but the new update has made everything money making and that sucks, i have been using this app since 2019 and it has always been use ful and helped me in my productivity. but now that everything requires money in this app , i might just leave the community

title: Unnecessary and terrible experience
text: A little counter intuitive but it gamifies studying which distracts you from the actual studying. Surprising amount of bugs with few features for a paid app. Very small annoyances, such as there's no way of knowing which trees you're planting you can only go by the picture.  And the subscription option is ridiculous, completely unnecessary and just tells me that they don't care about the user, just after some easy money.

title: Used to love it
text: Liked it better before the subscription. Paid to download the app and now I can‚Äôt even do half the things I actually used it for. I can‚Äôt even customize the tags when I use the timer like I used to.

title: Med Students‚Äô Savior
text: This app is genuinely a game changer, knowing that my proceeds go to actual charitable organizations that plant trees across the world made me respect this app‚Äôs developer team + the fact that I can have concentrated time on my iPhone without touching instagram is always a plus. This app is the best productivity app

title: Subscription ads
text: Very disappointed. Another app I originally liked that recently fell into the subscription category. Has a glaring crown icon on the timer page, an eye sore. All pro buyers should have been grandfathered in. It's the decent thing to do.

title: some weird bugs and ads but overall good for focusing
text: it was going good until I was on the third day trying to complete the "three focused days in a row" task and even though I have focused for three days, the reward won't come through. also, the ads are really annoying and interfere with everything because they sneak them into every other button. all things said, i do enjoy this app, just with some frusterations

title: Great App
text: I like that app helps you control your time ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: DONT DOWNLOAD
text: This app charged my card even though I never made an account!! I would really like a refund

title: Ads in free user
text: It is so disappointing that we had to pay to download the app and now we even have to pay not to appear ads while we‚Äôre studying??? Isn‚Äôt it to contracting from the system of focusing?

title: Okay, but used to be better
text: Unfortunately over time the app has become more and more crowded with extraneous bloat and now has a subscription option. It seems to me that simpler is better for this kind of software, but the number of fiddly features now packed in actually gets in the way of the primary aim of the app, focusing and getting off the phone. You can still just engage with the one(s) you want, but now it feels like there are big neon signs trying to draw your attention everywhere.

title: Ruined a perfectly good app
text: Non stop pop ups asking to purchase their subscription. Ruined a perfectly working app. Also the stupid break timer is annoying.

title: Best app ever
text: When I turned to ip I was so sad to find this app was paid it I searched again and I found it for free I‚Äôd didn‚Äôt hesitate to download it   I love using it with my friends  and the trees give a peaceful vibe love you

title: Ruined by ads
text: I loved this app and it helped me so much when my ADHD was bad. I started using it again and was so glad to start my forest again. One day I come on and all the features I loved were now blocked with a subscription pop up. EVERYTHING I‚Äôd try to use would cause a subscription pop up. I was devastated. I uninstalled the app because I cannot afford to pay for yet ANOTHER thing. üò≠ I‚Äôm crushed.

title: Changing my Review
text: DONT GET. Get bean focus app. Not only did they not listen to my review of letting you have any trees just for paying but they now have a subscription and I can‚Äôt even earn all the trees anymore. Why did they do this when you can just get the new bean focus app? I was still using this but I‚Äôm going to delete this app.

title: DISAPPOINTING Update
text: Why did you add the subscription? The ads are very annoying. I will no longer be using this app if the developers fail to even add a one time purchase for an ad-free experience. Give us back the old Forest!

title: Huge help for ADHD
text: Too many ‚Äúfree‚Äù timers aren‚Äôt free. This one is AND you can help plant real trees. Multiple preset timers for different activities and a wonderful optional breathing break in Between each session.

title: Ads?
text: I love this app. I started using it in the fall, and it‚Äôs been a game-changer for my focus and prioritization. Tonight I got a video ad after I finished planting a tree. I‚Äôm not upgrading to get rid of ads, especially after months of having an ad-free experience. I see a few more of them, I‚Äôm going to Tide.

title: Plus rollout discourages long-time Pro users
text: Many of the features that were included in Forest Pro have been put behind a paywall now that the subscription-based Plus model is being rolled out. Really disappointing that the Forest developers would renege on their previous promises to preserve these features to Pro users. I‚Äôll be switching to Flora or other time tracking apps

title: New Subscription is Needless CashGrab
text: A perfectly good app by the way but they just had to implement some sort of subscription and it‚Äôs 7$ a month for small bonus that add little to the new features. Disappointing.

title: The created a premium and took away features
text: The most recent update of the app has created a premium version of it. This premium version is essentially all of the interesting features that the regular version used to have, and they took them away from the original users of the app. I hate when apps do this because they‚Äôre essentially forcing us to spend money in order to keep what we‚Äôve already been used to using.

title: Bloated and expensive :(
text:
This app is getting bloated and expensive. I hope the developers roll back this subscription tier and the subscription ads that go with it. What used to be a simple, fun little app has become full of a random litte functions that just muddle the purpose. 

They'll add email soon enough, I'm sure.

title: Yet another subscription model‚Ä¶ ugh
text: I have used Forest for yearsssss. I love it. It has helped me so much. But I must say, it leaves a bitter taste in my mouth to see them pushing a subscription model now. It‚Äôs instant frustration when ever I see the icon‚Ä¶ so much I want to close the app. Developers need to realize subscription fatigue is a thing. Users aren‚Äôt rich and we shouldn‚Äôt have to continuously pay to use an app‚Ä¶ especially one we‚Äôve been using for years. If forest starts hiding some of the features behind the paywall as I suspect they will, I can guarantee they‚Äôll lose me (and others) for good. This isn‚Äôt a sustainable business plan for your consumers. If you want money, offer limited events or something. Not monthly/annual subscriptions. Entice us; don‚Äôt hold us hostage. Ugh.

title: Thumbs down
text: Paid for this app about 5 years ago & now I have to pay yearly for a bunch of features I had in the first place? Never using this app again. What a scam

title: Greed much?
text: Pay for the app, but now you insist on more money grabbing with a subscription? I bought this app because it was simple, but now you advertise plus version on every page of your app. I want my money back

title: Heartbroken dev switch to subscription model üíî
text:
I was an original supporter of forest and PAID for it almost a decade ago. The app recently updated and they added ‚ÄúForest Plus‚Äù a subscription based service.

Under the benefits, they mention removal of ads and deep focus model within a custom allow list. This feature was free and the app has never had ads before‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve used Forest for a decade and am heartbroken by the developers‚Äô decision to lock existing features behind a paywall. I guess I will have to just switch to the built in screen-time.

title: Good app
text: I‚Äôve been studying for hours thanks to this app. It‚Äôs so motivating and fun especially when you get so much work done meaning I can plant more trees.

title: Forced Subscription
text: I‚Äôve had this app for over a year and I loved it. Now, they are forcing you to subscribe and pay each month to access all the features I had been using up until now. Very disappointing and I will be deleting.

title: Used to Be Great - Now It‚Äôs Paywalled
text: I used to love Forest because you paid once and had access to everything. Now it‚Äôs become yet another monthly subscription. I really miss what the app used to be. Trees I previously bought with coins are now locked behind the membership, and with the temporary trial of the pro features going on, I‚Äôm not even sure if I‚Äôll be able to plant those trees once it ends. Regardless, it‚Äôs incredibly disappointing to see this shift to another subscription model.

title: Not good
text: I paid for the app to not have ads but the developers have gone back on the deal. Unhappy and upset

title: Please add a one-time purchase option instead of a subscription
text:
I love this app and apologize in advance for the one start review. 
Developers, please add an option to make a one time purchase to access the premium features alongside a subscription option. 
The idea of paying for an app and then needed to subscribe to it is ridiculous. 
Please don‚Äôt succumb to the greedy trends of other developers.

title: love it!

title: why add a subscription
text: this is ridiculous. i used this app for the past 3 years and all of a sudden there's a pay wall on all of the features besides the timer. it used to ALL be free. your greed sickens me. it's completely useless unless u pay a monthly charge. why would you betray your users like this. honestly disgusting.

title: Disappointing Update
text: I‚Äôve had this app since 2018, that‚Äôs 8 years, and I‚Äôve loved it to keep me on task. However this new update I think has taken the app in the wrong direction. Part of the reason this app is so great is that unlike similar timer/productivity apps this had no ‚Äúpremium‚Äù style membership. Adding on new features that you can only pay to access when I already paid for the original app is so lame, it makes it feel like a money grab. I understand companies have to make money but to me, this is a turn in the wrong direction. Just disappointed.

title: I shouldn‚Äôt have to subscribe for features I already paid for.
text: I‚Äôve been a long time user of the app and have been happy with it. I even like the new challenges and trees they‚Äôve been coming out with, but I‚Äôm upset that an app I already paid money to use is now putting features behind a subscription paywall. Why does everything need to be a subscription now? I can‚Äôt use my tags or buy trees with coins that I‚Äôve been looking forward to for a long time? At the very least, people who paid for the app should be grandfathered into the system.

title: ‚ú®Awesome app‚ú® 10/10 recommend
text: This app has been a game changer for me with keeping my ADHD-butt focused on (and motivated to do!) a task because you get to plant pretty trees, and if you use the labels well, it can show you where your weak spots are in your time management. It helped me cut back on my phone screen time, but it also helped me to realize that I (used to) spend too much time showering and getting ready in the mornings. Overall, this app has improved my life in so many ways, and I‚Äôm so grateful I found it!

title: Subscription for a paid app!!!

text: it suddenly stopped blocking my social media apps. Other people are having this problem. fix it rn

title: Love this app!!
text: The deep focus feature is my favorite!

title: Helped me get my brain back
text: I‚Äôve been using this app on and off for years. I‚Äôve enjoyed the timers and customization. Recently, I‚Äôve made a commitment to reducing social media and spending time doing and learning things I actually want to and this app has been my go-to for focus sessions. My one suggestion is to offer a 5-minute option. The shortest timer is 10 minutes and sometimes I just need 5.

title: love this app
text: such a great app to keep me focused

title: Great app but could be even better
text: I love this app and use it daily, but there is one issue I have with it. Currently, to grow your tree fully, you need to set your focus time for 120 minutes. But, research shows the importance of not sitting in one spot that long and true focus is optimized in shorter bursts of time. So, those of us who set our focus time to less than 120 min never get fully-grown trees. There should be a way that offsets that default if you continue to build your tree, but in smaller time periods. As long as you select the same tree after each break, it would continue to grow until it is complete. That way, you are getting the full perks of focusing and still doing it in a healthy and optimal way.

title: Helping me stay locked in
text: This app is 100% helping me with my job and just staying locked into my work as I grow my forest.

title: I Love forest and here‚Äôs why
text: Makes focusing feel rewarding instead of stressful.  Growing trees turns my studying etc more satisfying and seeing my forest gives me a sense of progress and how much time I focus on each subject. It stops distractions in a simple way. I love seeing the data as well it‚Äôs really cool.

title: Used to be fun, but now merely functional
text:
There was a period where the options for the trees you can plant were carefully and creatively designed to be more elaborate for the longer you focused. So, the more you focused, the cooler your little forest would look that day. They seem to have thrown that model away. It really diminishes the sense of accomplishment which drove the functionality of the app. 
Also, I swear that some of the shrub-sized options you can plant (like mushrooms) used to not be the exact same height as the actual trees. Now you get mushrooms the height of pine trees. Disappointing that those little details can‚Äôt even be managed.

title: So cute and helpful
text: I love that the app essentially turns focus into a game. So well done.

title: Works pretty well
text:
I have been using this for a few months on and off.  It is useful at keeping me from picking up the phone to scroll. 

I tried to create a login, but private Apple relay logins don‚Äôt work- they have more than the 30 character login limit. I contacted customer service - they got back to me quickly, so that is great. Their suggestion was just that I can make a login with my own email, but I prefer not to.
